app.py: from flask import Flask, request, jsonify

message.py: return {'sender': self.sender, 'receiver': self.receiver, 'message': 'All queued messages sent'}

steps: Step 1: Start by setting up the project structure and creating the necessary files. This includes the main application file (app.py), a file for user management (user.py), a file for message management (message.py), a file for group management (group.py), and a file for status management (status.py). Also, create a requirements.txt file to manage dependencies. Write a test to ensure that all files are created successfully and that the project structure is correct.

Step 2: Implement the user registration and authentication system. This includes functions for signing up with an email (sign_up), logging in (log_in), and password recovery (recover_password). The user data should be stored in a dictionary acting as a mock database. Write tests to ensure that the registration and authentication system works correctly.

Step 3: Implement the user profile management system. This includes functions for setting profile pictures (set_profile_picture), setting status messages (set_status_message), and managing privacy settings (manage_privacy_settings). Write tests to ensure that the user profile management system works correctly.

Step 4: Implement the contact management system. This includes functions for blocking and unblocking contacts (block_contact, unblock_contact), and for creating, editing, and managing groups (create_group, edit_group, manage_group). Write tests to ensure that the contact management system works correctly.

Step 5: Implement the messaging system. This includes functions for sending and receiving real-time text messages (send_message, receive_message), managing read receipts (manage_read_receipts), encrypting messages (encrypt_message), sharing images (share_image), and supporting emojis, GIFs, and stickers (support_emojis_gifs_stickers). Write tests to ensure that the messaging system works correctly.

Step 6: Implement the group chat system. This includes functions for creating group chats with a name and picture (create_group_chat), adding or removing participants (add_participant, remove_participant), and managing admin roles and permissions (manage_admin_roles). Write tests to ensure that the group chat system works correctly.

Step 7: Implement the status/story feature. This includes functions for posting image statuses visible for a limited time (post_status), and controlling who can see the status (control_status_visibility). Write tests to ensure that the status/story feature works correctly.

Step 8: Implement the web application. This includes setting up a Flask server in the main application file (app.py), and creating routes for all the functions implemented in the previous steps. Write tests to ensure that the web application works correctly.

Step 9: Implement the connectivity and offline mode. This includes functions for queuing messages when the user is offline (queue_message), and displaying online/offline status (display_status). Write tests to ensure that the connectivity and offline mode works correctly.

Step 10: Finally, run all the tests written in the previous steps to ensure that all parts of the application work correctly. If any tests fail, debug the corresponding part of the application and fix the issue. Once all tests pass, the application is ready for deployment.
step: Step 9: Implement the connectivity and offline mode. This includes functions for queuing messages when the user is offline (queue_message), and displaying online/offline status (display_status). Write tests to ensure that the connectivity and offline mode works correctly.

Python toolbelt preferences:
- pytest
- dataclasses
- flask

Objective:```
**Global Chat Service (GCS)**

**Overview**:  
A real-time online chat application allowing users to send text messages, images, and create group chats.

**Functional Requirements to implement**:

User Registration and Authentication:
- [ ] 1.1. Sign up using email.
- [ ] 1.2. Forgotten password recovery.

User Profile:
- [ ] 2.1. Allow users to set profile pictures and status messages.
- [ ] 2.2. Privacy settings for who can see user details or last seen status.

Contact Management:
- [ ] 3.1. Block/unblock contacts.
- [ ] 3.2. Create, edit, and manage groups.

Messaging:
- [ ] 4.1. Send and receive real-time text messages.
- [ ] 4.2. Message read receipts (blue ticks or equivalent).
- [ ] 4.3. End-to-end encryption for security.
- [ ] 4.4. Image sharing.
- [ ] 4.5. Emojis, GIFs, and stickers support.

Group Chats:
- [ ] 5.1. Create group chats with a name and picture.
- [ ] 5.2. Add or remove participants.
- [ ] 5.3. Admin roles and permissions.

Status/Story Feature:
- [ ] 6.1. Allow users to post image statuses visible for a limited time.
- [ ] 6.2. Control who can see the status.

Web Application:
- [ ] 7.1. Web-based version accessible from browsers.

Connectivity and Offline Mode:
- [ ] 8.1. Message queuing for when the user is offline; messages are sent once connectivity is restored.
- [ ] 8.2. Display online/offline status.
```

Understand the problem, by creating an extremely detailed step-by-step plan, where each step is long (multiple sentences) and in total includes every single feature requirement specified above, feel free to copy directly from it. Use no more than 10 steps in the plan. Create additional tests, checks and evaluation at each step when applicable to help make an excellent code implementation, where all the code is fully functional. Use best software design practices, and you can output large amounts of code at once. Please include a last sentence to create and run tests when implementing or writing code in that same step. You will receive no human input at any stage, so you cannot use a human to test. Only create a detailed plan to begin with, which includes designing and running tests to check that they all pass. Please be sure to include all of the specified feature requirements in the following plan.
